content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new structures have been successfully created. Repeated attempts to craft and place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) did not succeed—no Lab is present on the map. Although operations involved interacting with an alternative furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) for smelting, those were pre‐existing facilities used during resource processing rather than newly built structures. The final state confirms that no entities (and hence no structures) have been placed by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• API Call Errors with get_entities:
 – Using an unexpected keyword argument (e.g. ‘radius’) resulted in a TypeError.
 – Passing positional arguments that do not match the API signature also led to errors.
  • Tip: Always verify the expected parameter format (positional versus keyword) of get_entities before calling it.

• Lab Placement and Iteration Failures:
 – Attempts to place a Lab failed because no Lab was found in the inventory.
 – Iterating over a result that was None (instead of an empty list) caused a TypeError.
  • Tip: Check inventory for required objects prior to placement and validate returned collections to avoid iterating over None.

• Lab Crafting and Resource Shortages:
 – Crafting errors pointed to missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels and components needed for electronic-circuits, including copper-cable and copper-plate).
  • Tip: Ensure that the complete production chain is available—produce all prerequisite items in sufficient quantities before attempting to craft the Lab.

(Note: No utility functions have been defined by the agent, so no NAMESPACE section is included.)
